messages.content:
The Standex RFP is a Request for Proposal issued by Standex Electronics for developing custom software. The project aims to simplify and optimize their current design and quoting process, which currently involves a mix of custom Excel sheets, various software (both free and paid), and manual data extraction. The objective is to develop a unified and standardized toolset and workflow, reducing the dependence on fragmented systems and improving efficiency, especially for new hires. This will ultimately enhance productivity in the product design and quoting stages [2].

The RFP places a strong emphasis on maintaining confidentiality, stating that all information provided by Standex Electronics is confidential and must not be disclosed without written permission [1][3]. The document highlights the contributions from various business stakeholders and end users, ensuring their voices and needs are considered in the project [3]. The deadline and terms for proposal submission are included, emphasizing the need for written confirmation of receipt and intent to proceed from the vendor upon receiving the Scope of Work [1].
Tell me about the AI/ML layer

The AI/ML layer in the Standex RFP context is intended to enhance decision-making and improve design outputs over time, as the dataset grows. This involves either developing AI/ML models in-house or building upon existing open-source frameworks. When utilizing open-source solutions, legal and licensing restrictions will be adhered to, ensuring that proprietary information is not accidentally exposed or made public [3].

In terms of data handling, any proprietary data used for AI/ML processes must be kept secured within the system to prevent unauthorized exposure. If it is necessary to employ this data in broader AI/ML environments, robust processes and guardrails must be implemented to ensure that the data is anonymized. If anonymization is not feasible, strict protective measures must be enforced to prevent any leakage of sensitive or proprietary information [1][2].
